author: Helen Czerski
title: Behind Sparkling White Uniforms, an Optical Trick
text:
I saw the definitive herald of British summer for the first time last weekend: white-clad figures arranged across the green expanse of a cricket pitch, broadcasting the occasional clunk as a red ball was launched out to the boundary.
I’ve always thought that white is a particularly impractical color for an activity that involves a fair amount of sweat and sliding around on grass. But it’s not just a British anomaly—American baseball players also wear a lot of white. It’s logical to deduce that as the sports season progresses,...
